text:
- I'm Keerthana and I work
as an operations engineer
for AWS Managed Services.
I've been with AWS for two years now.
I did my masters in telecommunications

and I always wanted to
know what was I missing out
not being in the cloud
and I thought of exploring what AWS was
since it was already on the market

and when I started to look into
it and it was like an ocean
and I realized that AWS has a service

for everything and it is
really nice to be a part

of something that can
help customers globally.
I think the most impactful part

of AWS would be the customer
satisfaction for me.
I think it's really great to know

that your customer was
able to move forward
in the day without any issues

and also you could help them
with their infrastructure

do everything for the
customer on their behalf.

When I was a kid, I always
wanted to be an architect
and I treated my part to like an engineer.
But after coming to AWS, I realized

that I could always be
like a cloud architect.

In AWS, you can design the
networks for the customers.

So I think that's really
nice to kind of have
like your childhood dream,

but in perspective of an
engineer's point of view.
So I feel excited about it.
I've been in AWS for two years,

but when I look back, I know
that I've learned so much here.
If there's anyone asking how it is,

I would definitely recommend
it's like a 10 out of 10
because there is so much to learn in AWS.
